content.full_text: Check of James Shields to Abraham Lincoln, 1 March 18411 No.64662 (The holder of this warrant will be entitled to six per cent. interest from date, until redeemed by theState.)
paragraphs: Check of James Shields to Abraham Lincoln, 1 March 18411 No.64662 (The holder of this warrant will be entitled to six per cent. interest from date, until redeemed by theState.)
citations: An Act Making Appropriations for the Years 1841 and 1842.

footnotes.text:
1This partially printed check was filled in by James Shields and signed by Shields
                  and John D. Whiteside. Abraham Lincoln endorsed it on the back side.

3Members of the General Assembly earned $4 for each dayâ€™s attendance at the session,
                  plus  an additional $4 for every twenty miles of necessary travel in coming to and
                  returning from the statehouse.An Act Making Appropriations for the Years 1841 and 1842.
